references.reason: This is a foundational textbook in reinforcement learning, providing the theoretical background for many of the concepts and algorithms discussed in the paper.

references.paper_title: A general reinforcement learning algorithm that masters chess, shogi, and go through self-play
references.reason: This paper introduces AlphaZero, a groundbreaking reinforcement learning algorithm that achieved superhuman performance in several challenging games, demonstrating the potential of RL in complex domains.

references.paper_title: rl2: Fast reinforcement learning via slow reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper introduces RL2, a seminal work in meta-reinforcement learning, which directly inspired several cumulative-reward methods discussed and compared against in the current paper.

references.paper_title: VariBAD: A very good method for Bayes-adaptive deep RL via meta-learning
references.reason: This paper introduces VariBAD, a state-of-the-art cumulative-reward meta-RL algorithm that is compared against in the current paper, representing an important development in meta-RL methods.

references.paper_title: Human-timescale adaptation in an open-ended task space
references.reason: This paper introduces AdA, another state-of-the-art meta-RL algorithm and is compared in the paper, showcasing impressive sample efficiency and human-level adaptation in complex tasks.
